SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.percussion.server
Interface IPSRequestContext

public interface IPSRequestContext

The IPSRequestContext interface contains all the context of a given request.

Since:
1.1
Version:
1.1
Author:
DVG and Jian Huang

getRequestFileURL

String getRequestFileURL()
Get the file portion of the request URL which was specified when making this request. The protocol and host are excluded. For example, the URL http://localhost/Rhythmyx/app1/req.xml will return /Rhythmyx/app1/req.xml

Returns:
the file portion of the request URL

getRequestRoot

String getRequestRoot()
Get the request root, which consists of the Rhythmyx server's request root and the application's request root, such as /Rhythmyx/app1.

Returns:
the Rhythmyx request root portion of the request URL

getRequestPage

String getRequestPage()
Get the page name of the request URL, including the file extension. The protocol, host and Rhythmyx root are excluded. For example, the URL http://localhost/Rhythmyx/app1/request.xml will return request.xml

Returns:
the request page portion of the request URL

getRequestPage

String getRequestPage(boolean includeExtension)
Get the page name of the request URL and whether the extension is included depending on the input flag. The protocol, host and Rhythmyx root are excluded. For example, the URL http://localhost/Rhythmyx/app1/request.xml will return request.xml if includeExtension is true; otherwise, request is returned.

Parameters:
includeExtension - true to include file extension; false otherwise
Returns:
the request page portion of the request URL

getRequestPageType

int getRequestPageType()
Get the type of the request page.

Returns:
the IPSRequest.PAGE_TYPE_xxx request page type

getRequestPageExtension

String getRequestPageExtension()
Get the file extension associated with the request page. The returned extension includes the "." extension separator.

Returns:
the file extension, may be empty

getHookURL

String getHookURL()
Get the URL submitted through the hook of the request page.

Returns:
the URL submitted through the hook, or null if a hook was not used

getHeaders

Enumeration getHeaders()
Get the headers from the request

Returns:
an enumeration, never null

getParameter

String getParameter(String name,
                    Object defValue)
Get value of a parameter that was passed in with the request.

Parameters are usually sent as part of the URL when issuing an HTTP GET request. They are also possibly able to be sent as the body of an HTTP POST request.

When parsing the parameters specified in the URL (or in the POST data), parameter names may be repeated. Rhythmyx stores the lists of data as a List object. This method will only return the first list entry for the matched item. If access to all the data in the list is required, then use the getParameterList method.

For any non-string data, toString() will be called on the object. For objects such as file attachments, this will return the file name, not the contents, which may not be desirable.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter to retrieve, may not be null
defValue - the value to return if a parameter of the specified name does not exist, may be null
Returns:
the parameter's value, or defValue.toString() if it is not found. May be null if the supplied default value is null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.

getParameter

String getParameter(String name)
Convenience method, calls getParameter(name, null).

getParameterObject

Object getParameterObject(String name,
                          Object defValue)
Get a parameter that was passed in with the request, as an object.

Parameters are usually sent as part of the URL when issuing an HTTP GET request. They are also possibly able to be sent as the body of an HTTP POST request.

When parsing the parameters specified in the URL (or in the POST data), parameter names may be repeated. Rhythmyx stores the lists of data as a List object. This method will only return the first list entry for the matched item. If access to all the data in the list is required, then use the getParameterList method.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter to retrieve, may not be null
defValue - the value to return if a parameter of the specified name does not exist, may be null
Returns:
the parameter's value, or defValue if it is not found. May be null if defValue is null and value is not found for the specified parameter.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.

getParameterObject

Object getParameterObject(String name)
Convenience method, calls getParameterObject(name, null).

getParameters

HashMap getParameters()
Deprecated. Use getParametersIterator() for walking through the parameters.

Get the entire set of parameters which were passed in with the request.

Modifying the returned hash map will directly modify the parameters stored with the request. Any subsequent use of the getParameter methods will reflect the changes.

Returns:
the request parameters, never null may be empty.

getParameterList

Object[] getParameterList(String name)
Get values of a parameter that was passed in with the request.
Note: getParameterObject(String) gets only the first object in the list if the parameter has multiple values.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter to retrieve, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
the array of values for the specified parameter, or null if it is not found. If it is not null it will contain one or more elements.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.

removeParameter

Object removeParameter(String name)
Removes a parameter with specified name from the request parameters if it is found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter, may be null or empty.
Returns:
the value of the parameter. If name is null or empty or parameter is not found for the specified name, null will be returned.

appendParameter

void appendParameter(String name,
                     Object value)
Appends the supplied value to the list of values of the parameter with supplied name. If the parameter does not exist it creates an entry for it and sets the value as parameter value.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter, may not be null or empty.
value - object to be appended to the list of values, may be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.
IllegalStateException - if the type of objects in the parameter values does not match the type of object being appended.

hasMultiValuesForAnyParameter

boolean hasMultiValuesForAnyParameter()
Checks whether any of the parameters have multiple values.

Returns:
true if any of the parameters have multiple values, otherwise false

getParametersIterator

Iterator getParametersIterator()
Gets the list of parameters with each element as an entry set with parameter name as key and parameter value as value. Key is a String object, whereas the value can be any object. This iterator cannot be modified.

Returns:
the request parameters, never null, may be empty.

getFileCharacterSet

String getFileCharacterSet()
Get the character set associated with the request. The value returned will be:
  1. the request-specific file upload character encoding for this request or
  2. the Rhythmyx server's default character encoding if one has not been set or
  3. null which indicates the server will use the Java default encoding

Returns:
The request's character encoding, never empty, null indicates the default java encoding.

setFileCharacterSet

void setFileCharacterSet(String encoding)
Set the "file-upload" character set associated with the request. This should be either the IANA MIME-preferred registry name of the character set or Java's canonical name for the character set (preferred).

Parameters:
encoding - The request's character encoding, use null or empty to indicate to use the Rhythmyx server's default encoding. This method will only affect character-based file uploads. ResultDoc extensions attempting to modify the character set for this request will have no effect since all file-related processing will be completed prior to the resultDoc call.

setParameters

void setParameters(HashMap params)
Deprecated. Use setParameter(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object) and removeParameter(java.lang.String) for modifying the parameters.

Set parameters associated with this request to the specified HashMap.
Note:If this method is used for setting the parameters after balancing by the user directly in the existing code(in the exits before v4.1), server treats the copies in the parameter values as new values rather than the repeated values.

Parameters:
params - the parameters associated with this request, may not be null, may be empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if params is null

setParameter

void setParameter(String name,
                  Object value)
Replaces the value of an existing entry or creates a new entry in the parameter map.

Parameters are usually sent as part of the URL when issuing a HTTP GET request. It is also possible to send parameters as the body of a HTTP POST request. When parsing the parameters specified in the URL (or in the POST data), parameter names may be repeated. Rhythmyx stores the lists of data as a List object. So to set multiple values for a parameter, pass a List object for the value.

Note: If this method is used in the existing code(in the exits before v4.1) to set a parameter value which is already balanced, the server treats the copies in the balanced list as new values rather than repeated values.

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter to add/modify. May not be null or empty.
value - An Object, the value to set it to. May be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.

setParameterList

void setParameterList(String name,
                      Object[] values)
Assigns the specified values to the named parameter, replacing any existing value.

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter to add/modify. May not be null or empty.
values - An array of values to assign as the value for the named parameter. May be null or empty, all objects in this array must be of the same type.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty or the supplied value array contains objects of more than one type.

getTruncatedParameters

Map getTruncatedParameters()
Gets a copy of the parameters which were passed in with the request ensuring that they have single values. If the parameter values are Lists, they will be truncated to the first Object in the list. Modifying the returned Map will not directly modify this object.

Returns:
The request parameters map containing single values. The key is the String representation of the parameter name, and the value is an Object, usually a String, but possibly something else (e.g. a File object), but no entries should have List objects for their values.

getCgiVariable

String getCgiVariable(String name)
Get a CGI variable associated with the request.

CGI variables are created by Rhythmyx (or the web server when a hook such as an ISAPI extension is used). These variables contain various pieces of information associated with the request, such as the request headers.

Parameters:
name - the name of the CGI variable to retrieve
Returns:
the requested CGI variable's value, or null if the requested entry is not found

setCgiVariable

void setCgiVariable(String cgiVarName,
                    String cgiVarValue)
Set a CGI variable associated with the request.

Parameters:
cgiVarName - the name of the variable, never null or empty
cgiVarValue - the value, never null or empty

getRequestCookie

String getRequestCookie(String name,
                        String defValue)
Get a cookie which was passed in the headers associated with the request.

Parameters:
name - the name of the cookie to retrieve
defValue - the default value to return if the requested entry is not found
Returns:
the requested cookie's value, or defValue if the requested entry is not found

getRequestCookie

String getRequestCookie(String name)
Get a cookie which was passed in the headers associated with the request.

Parameters:
name - the name of the cookie to retrieve
Returns:
the requested cookie's value, or null if the requested entry is not found

setResponseCookie

void setResponseCookie(String name,
                       String value,
                       String path,
                       String domain,
                       Date expires,
                       boolean secure)
Set a cookie which will be sent along with the response.

Parameters:
name - the name of the cookie
value - the value of the cookies
path - the URL path that the cookie is valid for (for example, / for the entire site, /xyz for requests in the /xyz path, etc.)
domain - the host that the cookie is valid for (e.g., www.percussion.com)
expires - the date that the cookie expires
secure - true if the cookie should only be sent over HTTPS connections

getResponseCookies

HashMap getResponseCookies()
Get the entire set of cookies which will be sent along with the response.

The name of a cookie is stored as a hash key. Other components of a cookie are stored as the corresponding hash value. When setting cookies, the permitted syntax for the value is:

[;path=][;domain=][;expires=][;secure]

where:

value is the value of the cookie

path is the URL path that the cookie is valid for (for example, / for the entire site, /xyz for requests in the /xyz path, etc.)

domain is the host that the URL is valid for (e.g., www.percussion.com)

expires is the date the cookie expires in "Day, DD-Mon-YYYY HH:MM:SS TZ" format, such as: "Fri, 01-Jan-1999 00:00:00 GMT"

secure is used to signify the cookie should only be sent over HTTPS connections

Modifying the returned HashMap will directly modify the cookies. Any subsequent use of the getResponseCookie methods will reflect the changes.

Returns:
the cookies;

setResponseCookies

void setResponseCookies(HashMap cookies)
Sets the cookies which will be sent along with the response to the specified hash map.

Parameters:
cookies - the cookies to be send with the response (may be null)

getInputDocument

Document getInputDocument()
Gets the XML document sent as input for the request. If an XML document is not sent with the request, null will be returned.

Modifying the returned XML document will directly modify this object. Any subsequent use of the XML document or the getInputDocument method will see the changed data.

Returns:
the input document; or null if an XML document was not sent with the request

setInputDocument

void setInputDocument(Document inDoc)
Sets the XML document to be used as input for the request. If a call to getInputDocument was made, any modifications of that document will be reflected in the request. Therefore, a call to this method would not be required in that case.

Parameters:
inDoc - the input document associated with this request (may be null)

getPreferredLocale

Locale getPreferredLocale()
Gets the requestor's preferred locale. This is done by checking the language setting provided by the user agent (e.g., browser). The best fit language will be returned (if available).

Returns:
the requestor's preferred locale

getCurrentApplicationAccessLevel

int getCurrentApplicationAccessLevel()
Gets the access level assigned to this user for the application processing this request. Access levels are defined by the com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSAclEntry.AACE_XXX flags. These XXX are:

AACE_DATA_CREATE which allows creating of back end rows AACE_DATA_DELETE which allows deleting of existing back end rows AACE_DATA_QUERY which allows querying of back end rows and reading of application files (such as style sheets, DTDs, etc.) AACE_DATA_UPDATE which allows updating of existing back end rows

Returns:
the access level in the current application

getCurrentApplicationName

String getCurrentApplicationName()
Gets the current application name, or the application's request root, such as /app1.

Returns:
the Rhythmyx application root portion of the request URL

getPrivateObject

Object getPrivateObject(Object key)
                        throws com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException
Gets a private object associated with this execution context. It is provided as a storage area for extension or exit handlers, etc., to create context information once.

Parameters:
key - the key under which the object is stored
Returns:
the private object associated with the key
Throws:
com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException - if key is null

setPrivateObject

void setPrivateObject(Object key,
                      Object o)
                      throws com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException
Sets a private object associated with this execution context. This is provided as a storage area for exits to create context information once.

Parameters:
key - the unique key under which the object is stored
o - the private object associated with the key
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
com.percussion.error.PSRuntimeException

getSessionPrivateObject

Object getSessionPrivateObject(Object key)
Gets a private object associated with this user session. This is provided as a storage area for exits to create context information once. This can then be retrieved across requests throught the user's session.

Parameters:
key - The key under which the object is stored, must not be null. This name will allow the object to be retrieved during the life of the user session.
Returns:
the private object associated with the key
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null

setSessionPrivateObject

void setSessionPrivateObject(Object key,
                             Object o)
Sets a private object associated with this user session. This is provided as a storage area for exit handlers, etc. to create context information once. This can then be retrieved across requests throught the user's session.

Parameters:
key - the key under which the object is stored. Be sure to to specify a unique name -- that is, something other exits using this mechanism will not likely use as a name
o - the private object associated with the key

getSessionObject

Object getSessionObject(String key)
Gets a system object associated with this user session. This is provided as a storage area for exits to create context information once. This can then be retrieved across requests throught the user's session.

Parameters:
key - The key under which the object is stored, must not be null. This name will allow the object to be retrieved during the life of the user session.
Returns:
the system object associated with the key
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null or empty

getUserRoles

List getUserRoles(String provider,
                  String providerInstance,
                  String name)
Deprecated. use getSubjectRoles(PSSubject) instead.

Re-added for custom exit backwards compatiblity. Calls getSubjectRoles( new PSGlobalSubject(name, PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_USER, null)).

getSubjectRoles

List getSubjectRoles(PSSubject subject)
Gets the role names to which the specified subject belongs, as a List of Strings. Since application-specific roles have been deprecated, this method will only return server-based role information.

Parameters:
subject - The properties that uniquely identify someone within the Rx security system. If null, the subject that made the request is used. If anonymous, an empty list is returned.
Returns:
A valid list of 0 or more role names, 1 for each role containing the specified user or group. List elements will be of type String. The list is sorted in ascending alpha order.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is invalid.
Since:
4.0

getSubjectRoles

List getSubjectRoles()
Convenience method that gets the role names to which the subject making the request belongs, as a List of Strings. Convenience method. Calls getSubjectRoles(null).

Since:
4.0

getSubjectRoles

List getSubjectRoles(String subjectName)
Similar to getSubjectRoles(PSSubject), but ignores the security provider information. If there is only a single subject that has the supplied name, then it will return the same list as the aforementioned method. If more than 1 name match, it will return all roles from all matching subjects.

Parameters:
subjectName - The full name of the desired person. Never null or empty.
Returns:
A valid list of 0 or more Strings, each of which is the name of a role that contains a subject by the supplied name and has a type of PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_USER. Each role name is unique within the list.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if subjectName is null or empty.
Since:
4.0

getRoles

List getRoles()
Gets all role names on the system, as a List of Strings.

Returns:
A list of 0 or more role names, 1 for each role on the system. List elements will be of type String. The list is sorted in ascending alpha order.
Since:
4.0

getRoleSubjects

List getRoleSubjects(String roleName)
Convenience method that gets all the subjects for the specified role, as a List of PSSubjects. Calls getRoleSubjects( roleName, 0, null ).

Since:
4.0

getRoleSubjects

List getRoleSubjects(String roleName,
                     int memberFlags,
                     String subjectNameFilter)
Gets the subjects that match the supplied criteria (for the specified role), as a List of PSSubjects.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role. If null or empty, all subjects matching the criteria are returned, regardless of what roles they belong too.
memberFlags - One or more of the PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_xxx flags. These filter types may be or'ed together to indicate multiple types of subjects. If 0 is specified, all types will be returned.
subjectNameFilter - A single pattern for subject names. Filters use SQL LIKE syntax. If null or empty, no filtering will be done, all names will be considered a match.
Returns:
A list of 0 or more subjects in the role as PSSubjects sorted in ascending alpha order by subject name.
Since:
4.0

getSubjects

List getSubjects(String subjectNameFilter)
Convenience method that gets the subjects that match the supplied criteria (from any role), as a List of PSSubjects. Calls getRoleSubjects(null, PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_USER, subjectNameFilter).

Since:
4.0

getRoleAttributes

List getRoleAttributes(String roleName)
Gets the attributes for the specified role, as a List of PSAttributes.

Parameters:
roleName - The name of the role to retrieve attributes for. Can not be null or empty.
Returns:
A valid set of 0 or more PSAttribute objects. May be empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If roleName is null or empty.
Since:
4.0

getSubjectGlobalAttributes

List getSubjectGlobalAttributes(String subjectNameFilter,
                                int subjectType,
                                String roleName,
                                String attributeNameFilter,
                                boolean includeEmptySubjects,
                                String communityId)
Gets only the global attributes for a set of subjects.

Parameters:
subjectNameFilter - A single pattern used to find the individual(s) whose attributes you wish. Wildcards allowed following SQL LIKE syntax. If null or empty, all subjects are included.
subjectType - One of the PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_xxx flags. Provide 0 to ignore this property.
roleName - This is only useful if wildcards are used for the subject name. If provided, limits the subjects to those that appear in this role.
attributeNameFilter - A single pattern used to select the desired attributes. Use SQL LIKE syntax. Supply empty or null to get all attributes.
includeEmptySubjects - A flag to indicate whether subjects with no attributes should be included in the returned list. If true, they are included, otherwise, only subjects that have 1 or more attributes are included.
communityId - the community to which the subjects must be a member of, may be null or empty in which case no filtering is done based on community
Returns:
A valid list of 0 or more PSSubjects containing either 1 or more attributes (if includeEmptySubjects is false) or 0 or more attributes (if includeEmptySubjects is true), ordered in ascending alpha order by subject name. The caller takes ownership of the list.

getSubjectGlobalAttributes

List getSubjectGlobalAttributes(String subjectNameFilter,
                                int subjectType,
                                String roleName,
                                String attributeNameFilter,
                                boolean includeEmptySubjects)
Gets the global attributes for the specified subjects. Convenience method that gets the attributes of the subject that made the current request. See getSubjectGlobalAttributes(String, int, String, String, boolean, String) for a full description.

getSubjectGlobalAttributes

List getSubjectGlobalAttributes()

Since:
4.0

getSubjectGlobalAttributes

List getSubjectGlobalAttributes(PSSubject subject)

Parameters:
subject - The definition of a subject in the Rx security system. If null, the subject of the current request is used.
Since:
4.0

getSubjectRoleAttributes

List getSubjectRoleAttributes(String subjectNameFilter,
                              int subjectType,
                              String roleName,
                              String attributeNameFilter)
Gets the role specific attributes for the specified subjects.

Parameters:
subjectNameFilter - A single pattern used to find the individual(s) whose attributes you wish. Wildcards allowed following SQL LIKE syntax. If null or empty, all subjects are included.
subjectType - One of the PSSubject.SUBJECT_TYPE_xxx flags. Provide 0 to ignore this property.
roleName - A valid role. Can't be null or empty. If the role doesn't exist, an empty list is returned.
attributeNameFilter - A pattern used to select the desired attributes. Use SQL LIKE syntax. Supply empty or null to get all attributes.
Returns:
A valid List of 0 or more PSSubject objects, each containing 1 or more attributes that match the supplied criteria. May be empty. Subjects without matching attributes will not be included in the List.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If roleName is null or empty.
Since:
4.0

getSubjectRoleAttributes

List getSubjectRoleAttributes(String roleName)
Convenience method that gets the role attributes of the subject that made the current request. Calls getSubjectRoleAttributes( null, roleName).

Since:
4.0

getSubjectRoleAttributes

                              String roleName)

Parameters:

roleName - The name of the role to which the supplied subject belongs and may have attributes. Never null or empty.
Throws:

getRoleEmailAddresses

Set getRoleEmailAddresses(String roleName,
                          String emailAttributeName,
                          String community)
Get all email addresses from all subjects that belong to the supplied role. Convenience method that calls roleName, emailAttributeName, community, null.

getRoleEmailAddresses

Set getRoleEmailAddresses(String roleName,
                          String emailAttributeName,
                          String community,
                          Set subjectsWithoutEmail)
Get all email addresses from all subjects that belong to the supplied role for all defined security providers.

Parameters:
roleName - the role for which to get all subject emails, not null or empty.
emailAttributeName - the email attribute name used for backend security providers, may be empty or null. If supplied all emails defined through backend security providers are included, otherwise backend security provider lookups will be skipped.
community - the community for which to filter the result, may be null or empty to ignore the community filter.
subjectsWithoutEmail - an empty set in which all subjects (as PSSubject objects) without an email address will be returned. May be null if users without email are not of interest.
Returns:
a set of email addresses as String objects in alpha ascending order, never null, may be empty.

getSubjectEmailAddresses

Set getSubjectEmailAddresses(String subjectName,
                             String emailAttributeName,
                             String community)
Get all email addresses from the supplied subject.

Parameters:
subjectName - the subject from which to get all emails, not null or empty.
emailAttributeName - the email attribute name, may be empty or null. If supplied all emails defined in the backend tables are included, otherwise backend lookups will be skipped.
community - the community for which to filter the result, may be null or empty to ignore the community filter.
Returns:
a set of email addresses as String objects, never null, may be empty.

                    int flags,
                    int memberFlags)
Deprecated. use getRoleSubjects(String, int, String) to obtain information on role members

Now behaves the same as calling getRoleSubjects(roleName, memberFlags, null). If an exception occurs while getting the members, an empty list is returned.

Parameters:
flags - No longer supported.

getUserContextInformation

Object getUserContextInformation(String contextItem,
                                 Object defValue)
                                 throws com.percussion.data.PSDataExtractionException
Retrieve user context information from the current request context.

Parameters:
contextItem - The name of the desired aspect of the user context. See the following table for a list of the supported items.
Context Item Identifiers
ElementDescription
SessionId The session identifier associated with this request
User/Name An entry for each user the requestor has been authenticated as
User/Attributes The attributes associated with this user (security provider specific).
Roles/RoleName The roles the requestor is a member of
DataAccessRights/query 1 if the requestor can query; 0 otherwise
DataAccessRights/insert 1 if the requestor can insert; 0 otherwise
DataAccessRights/update 1 if the requestor can update; 0 otherwise
DataAccessRights/delete 1 if the requestor can delete; 0 otherwise
DesignAccessRights/modifyAcl 1 if the requestor can modify the applciation's ACL; 0 otherwise
DesignAccessRights/readDesign 1 if the requestor can read the application design; 0 otherwise
DesignAccessRights/updateDesign 1 if the requestor can update the application design; 0 otherwise
DesignAccessRights/deleteDesign 1 if the requestor can delete the application design; 0 otherwise
defValue - A default object to be returned, in the case where the desired aspect is null
Throws:
com.percussion.data.PSDataExtractionException - if an error occurs extracting the user context information
IllegalArgumentException - if roleName is invalid

printTraceMessage

void printTraceMessage(String message)
Sends a trace message for debugging purposes. The message will be written to the trace output specified by the application. The message may contain new lines, but if the lines are longer than the trace output column width setting for the application, they will be wrapped.

Parameters:
message - The text of the message.

isTraceEnabled

boolean isTraceEnabled()
Checks to see if tracing for the current application is enabled, and also if tracing option for Exit trace messages is enabled.

Returns:
true if both tracing is enabled for the application and for the exit tracing option.

setGeneralHeader

boolean setGeneralHeader(String name,
                         String value)
Adds an HTTP header to the list of headers that will be written when the response is sent. There are 3 types of headers: general, response and entity. Depending on type, the server may limit what values can be set. Only the following headers can be set with this method:
  1. Cache-Control
  2. Connection
  3. Date
  4. Pragma
  5. Transfer-Encoding
  6. Upgrade
  7. Via
The headers are written in the following order: general, response, cookies and entity headers.

Parameters:
name - The name of the header, case insensitive. May not be null.
value - The value for this header. May not be null.
Returns:
true if the header is set, false if it is not recognized.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name or value is null

setEntityHeader

boolean setEntityHeader(String name,
                        String value)
Adds an HTTP header to the list of headers that will be written when the response is sent. Any header can be written using this method. If the header is described in the doc for either setGeneralHeader or setResponseHeader, those methods should be used to set those header variables.

Parameters:
name - The name of the header, case insensitive. May not be null or empty.
value - The value for this header. May not be null.
Returns:
always true
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty or value is null.
See Also:
setGeneralHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

setResponseHeader

boolean setResponseHeader(String name,
                          String value)
Adds an HTTP header to the list of headers that will be written when the response is sent. Only the following headers can be set with this method:
  1. Age
  2. Location
  3. Proxy-Authenticate
  4. Public
  5. Retry-After
  6. Server
  7. Vary
  8. Warning
  9. Set-Cookie
  10. WWW-Authenticate

Parameters:
name - The name of the header, case insensitive. May not be null.
value - The value for this header. May not be null.
Returns:
true if the header is set, false if it is not recognized.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if name or value is null

getInternalRequest

IPSInternalRequest getInternalRequest(String resource)
Convenience method for getting an internal request without adding to the request parameters (which are cloned from the current request). Calls getInternalRequest(resource, null, true).

getInternalRequest

IPSInternalRequest getInternalRequest(String resource,
                                      Map extraParams,
                                      boolean inheritCurrentParams)
Gets the internal request object used to execute a request against the specified resource. The internal request object will have its own request context seeded with the values of, but independent from, this request context. (Changes made to the request context during the internal request will not be reflected in the original request context.) Any parameters specified in a query string as part of resource or included extraParams will be added to the internal request's context.

TODO:- Update this documentation when category support is implemented

Parameters:
resource - specifies the application and page of the dataset to make an internal request of. Specifies the application and page of the dataset to which the internal request is to be made. May optionally include a "query string" -- name/value pairs, separated by equals, delimited by ampersand, and identified as the portion of the path following a question mark. May be as little as "appName/pageName" or as much as "http://127.0.0.1:9992/Rhythmyx/AppTest/nov.xml?alpha=bravo&test=5 ". Not null or empty.
extraParams - an optional group of parameters to be added to the internal request's context. Skipped if null.
inheritCurrentParams - If true, the internal request context will contain copies of all of the parameters in the current request in addition to any parameters from the query string in resource and extraParams.

If false, the internal request context will only have those parameters supplied by the query string in resource and extraParams.

Returns:
the internal request object, null if no suitable handler was found.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the request string is null, empty, or not in the correct format.

getContentHeaderOverride

String getContentHeaderOverride()
Gets the content header override string. If this value is null, no override is to be made. If this value is the empty string, then the content header will be cleared.

Returns:
the full content header to use for this request

setContentHeaderOverride

void setContentHeaderOverride(String header)
Sets the content header override string. This string will be returned in query responses instead of computing a mimetype/encoding based on the request extension. To disable overriding the content header, set to null. To use no content header, set to the empty string. All other strings will be passed as the complete content header as specified.

Parameters:
header - The string to use as the content header for this request, or null if no override is to be used.

getSecurityToken

PSSecurityToken getSecurityToken()
Get the security token associated with this request. This represents the user's session and can be used to make requests in certain situations where a full request context is not required.

Returns:
The token, never null.

getUserLocale

String getUserLocale()
Returns the locale orlanguage string associated with this user request, Never null or empty.

pauseRequestTimer

void pauseRequestTimer()
Each request is created with a request timer that allows us to track the time spent in that individual request. This method allows the exclusion of time from that total time. Pause can be called any number of times, but should be matched with calls to continueRequestTimer() to restart the timer. Note that the timer does not actually do any processing while running, it simply tracks the start time, end time and any accumulated pause time to provide statistics. See PSStopwatch for more details on this type of timer.

expandGroups

Set<PSSubject> expandGroups(Set<PSSubject> subjects)
Attempts to replace any subjects in the supplied list that are goups with subjects representing the members of the groups. Handling of nested groups is implementation specific depending on the cataloger that resolves the group. Any supplied subjects that are users are simply added to the returned set.

Parameters:
subjects - A set of subjects, may contain both users and groups. Never null, may be empty.
Returns:
A new set containing all users supplied, and any users that were the result of expanding the membership of any groups supplied, and any groups that could not be expanded or that were returned as members of a supplied group.

continueRequestTimer

void continueRequestTimer()
Turns the timer back "on" for the request. See pauseRequestTimer() for the details of this.
